item.title: Sample Database Structure
item.author: slh.peyman@gmail.com (Peyman Salehi)
item.description: This is an overview of sample database that you imported from setup post. Overview We’re assuming that we have an eCommerce website and have some tables like, users, product_categories, products, orders, and user_logs. Users table Users table have the following structure. table name: users column type id int datetime_joined datetime first_name varchar last_name varchar email varchar city varchar active boolean Sample data: id datetime_joined first_name last_name email city active 1 2023-03-07 12:45:12.

item.title: Setup
item.author: slh.peyman@gmail.com (Peyman Salehi)
item.description: If you want to run the examples in the following posts, you can follow these instructions to setup your environment and import our sample data to work with. PostgreSQL If you have PostgreSQL installed, you can skip step 1. 1: Run PostgreSQL You can download and install docker and docker compose from docker website. Create a docker-compose.yml file: version: '3' services: postgres: image: postgres:latest environment: - POSTGRES_USER=sbe - POSTGRES_PASSWORD=sqlbyexample - POSTGRES_DB=sbe ports: - "5432:5432" volumes: - postgres_data:/var/lib/postgresql/data/ volumes: postgres_data: Then, run:
